result.execSummary:
All charges against Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo

records.addlTxt: Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hans Peter Koesser in court for Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo. Defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo in court, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. On state's motion this case is dismissed.

Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hans Peter Koesser in court for Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo. Defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. During the plea colloquy the DE seemed to be having some trouble. DE's mother in court and states she does not believe the DE is thinking clearly.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Case should be in br 2 with all other corresponding cases.
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Due to court's unavailability on 9/14; Status conf adj to 10/7 @ 11:30am.  Confirming email to attys
from Rebecca Palmer at Kenosha Human Development Services
ROTATION
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Due to a conflict in the court calendar the STC of 08/25/22 at 2:30 has been adjourned to 09/14/22 at 2:30.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State by zoom.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Koesser.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Koesser's bond motion. For reasons set forth on the record the bond motion is denied.
With Attorney Koesser a MH has been set to 07/08/22 at 10:30 on the Bond Motion.
to Reduce Bail

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Defendant in custody by zoom w/Attorney  H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Koesser states he wants to look into behavioral health court for the deft. STC continued to 8/25/22 at 2:30pm. Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Koesser.   Clerk. M.Burke. Atty Koesser asks for more time to see if DE can get into the Jail diversion program. STC set to 06/01/22 at 4:00.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not To Discuss Case w/ Casimiro H.

01:07 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered. Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am. $100  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Amended complaint acknowledged by Atty Koesser.  sg
filed by Atty. Hans Koesser  kmk
